data.title: Resource: map fails .yaml check if contains AttackCharge
data.body:
When I uploaded a map which had balance changes, containing "AttackCharge:" for the Obelisk, the site gave me an error and said it failed the yaml check, and it would not display a map preview. It didn't work regardless of whether there were sub-entires under AttackCharge: or whether that entry was there by itself. 

The map worked fine in-game. (It was a CNC map).

Here is the error message:

```
OpenRA.Lint(1,1): Error: Missing Type: AttackChargeInfo
OpenRA.Lint(1,1): Error: Failed with exception: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
at OpenRA.FileFormats.FieldLoader.Load (System.Object self, OpenRA.FileFormats.MiniYaml my) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.ActorInfo.LoadTraitInfo (System.String traitName, OpenRA.FileFormats.MiniYaml my) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.ActorInfo..ctor (System.String name, OpenRA.FileFormats.MiniYaml node, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 allUnits) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.Rules.m__161 (OpenRA.FileFormats.MiniYamlNode k, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 y) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.Rules+c__AnonStorey78`1[OpenRA.ActorInfo].<>m__16A (OpenRA.FileFormats.MiniYamlNode kv) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.Exts.ToDictionaryWithConflictLog[MiniYamlNode,String,ActorInfo] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 keySelector, System.Func`2 elementSelector, System.String debugName, System.Func`2 logKey, System.Func`2 logValue) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.Rules.LoadYamlRules[ActorInfo] (System.String[] files, System.Collections.Generic.List`1 dict, System.Func`3 f) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.Rules.LoadRules (OpenRA.FileFormats.Manifest m, OpenRA.Map map) [0x00000] in :0
at OpenRA.Lint.YamlChecker.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in :0
```

data.title: Improve ProductionBar performance.
data.body: Querying the production queues every render frame was crazy.

data.title: Fixed welding animations playing when there are no vehicles produced
data.body: as described in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3756. Probably also useful for Tiberian Sun.

data.title: Add singleplayer mission menu to ra/td
data.body: Closes #4603

data.title: Nerfing guard towers & other balance changes
data.body:
- Range of obelisk, Adv. Guard Tower and SAM site reduced.
- Damage of Guard Tower reduced vs. infantry and light vehicles; spread increased to compensate a bit.
- Damage of Advanced Guard Tower nerfed, especially against light vehicles. Damage vs. infantry increased (though it's still low DPS). Spread also increased to compensate for its lack of power vs. infantry.
- Turret damage mostly unchanged, but does less damage per shot. Damage vs. light vehicles increased to match its damage vs. heavy armor. Damage vs. infantry slightly reduced.

data.title: can't pick up crate near bridge
data.body:
Infantry couldn't pick up crate near bridge. I thought I saw another passing infantryman walk right over it but not pick it up.

When I click on that tile to pick it up, nothing happens.

Screenshot:
http://imgur.com/J4FDlAi

data.title: Don't spit errors if directories to be cleaned are missing
Tech structures shouldn't have MustBeDestroyed
make clean errors if md build dirs are missing
data.body:
Introduced by #5089.

```
paul@Mjolnir:OpenRA+pr/5123$ make clean
rm: ./*/obj: No such file or directory
rm: ./*/bin: No such file or directory
make: [clean] Error 1 (ignored)
```

data.title: Added ExplosionPalette and WaterExplosionPalette traits to Warheads
data.body:
This is needed for TS water splashes, for example (they use unit*.pal instead of anim.pal, converting them to anim.pal results in significant quality regression due to lack of compatible colors in anim.pal).

Defaults to "effect".

Currently there aren't any test cases in the shipping mods, but I tested this with custom versions of the RA and TS mods and it worked as intended.

data.title: Added crane build animation to construction yards in Dune 2000 and Tiberian Sun
Additions to Makefile for cleaning up OpenRA.Game/*.dll left-overs
data.body:
followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5089 after `git status` detected these:

```
        OpenRA.Game/ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.dll
        OpenRA.Game/OpenRA.FileFormats.dll
        OpenRA.Game/OpenRA.FileFormats.dll.mdb
        OpenRA.Game/SharpFont.dll
        OpenRA.Game/Tao.OpenAl.dll
```

data.title: Hotkey 'Enable Double Pixeling' for all mods
data.body: This feature would enable you to easily switch views in-game and in replay mode. Useful when playing or casting.

data.title: [RA] Upgrade observer/replay interface features.
data.body:
EDIT: Narrowing the aim down to the RA mod exclusively. If one day successful it could leak on to the other mods. Would be worth having for the current ORA flagship.

I'd love to see a re-design of the statistics bar as suggested in #4716 for all default mods (TD, RA & D2K) with hotkeys bound to each tab.

Due to the long discussion at #4716 and recent interest I'll clarify the goals on this issue (details below) for anyone wanting to take a stab at it.

data.title: Spread needs fixing: e.g. Ion Cannon in TD
data.body:
It seems that the Spread logic works a bit different in between Release and Playtest. The Ion Cannon behaves differently, for example, even though its stats have not changed. It does not do as much damage to the communications centre now, and doesn't destroy it anymore. This difference only seems to apply to some buildings, not others. The buildings which are taller (3 cells tall) like the war factory and refinery seem unaffected. But buildings which are 2 cells tall receive far less damage now (e.g. landing strip, which is 4x2; comm. centre...).

Also, I haven't precisely measured it yet, but I think I have also noticed a slight difference in how ion cannon damage spreads across units. It seems slightly less powerful.

data.title: unit upgrade building
data.body:
i think it would be awesome to be able to buy unit upgrades. for example + 2 speed for tanks or more ammo, hp or range etc. for other specific units. somebody like this idea and is able to add this function to openra?? seems like it not possible using yaml only...
